Package ohos.ivihardware.adas

Class InfoAssistManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.adas.InfoAssistManager

  • public class InfoAssistManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A public class that obtains information about ADAS information-specific signals.

    This class provides basic information-specific signal identifiers and access methods. You can use the defined signal identifiers to obtain specified signal values.

    The ADAS information domain provides signals for object information, common vehicle information, lane lines, freespace, driver status, network security, event data recorder (EDR), H.265 video, and high-definition map.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.ADAS

      Identifies the signal for system faults, including the faults in heartbeat, AEB, cruise, and parking.

      Identifies the signal for the request of taking photos.
      static java.lang.String ID_INFO_TRANSFER_360DATA_SWITCH
      Identifies the signal for 360-degree image data transfer.

      • ID_INFO_EDRFILE_DELETE

        public static final java.lang.String ID_INFO_EDRFILE_DELETE
        Identifies the signal for requesting EDR data deletion. This signal is used to remind customers to connect to the network so that new data will overwrite earlier data or to go to 4S shops to delete EDR data.

        Data type: byte buffer

        Node type: sensor

        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getAdasSignal

        public static byte[] getAdasSignal​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                                   byte[] request)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                   java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the ADAS signal value of the specified byte array type.

        You can obtain only the ADAS information-specific signal values that support query. The signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to serialize and deserialize the signal values.

        Sample code for obtaining an ADAS signal value: 

         
 try {
     byte[] signalValue = InfoAssistManager.getAdasSignal(InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_HDMINFO);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the ADAS signal value to obtain.
        request - Indicates the request for the ADAS signal value in byte array, which needs to be serialized based on the specified format.
        Returns:
        Returns the signal value in a byte array, which needs to be deserialized based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be obtained, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • getAdasSignal

        public static <T> T getAdasSignal​(java.lang.Class<T> propClass,
                                  java.lang.String propertyId)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                  ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                  java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the ADAS signal value of a specified primitive data type.

        You can obtain the signal value of only the specified node type. The data type of the signal value can be byte, short, int, float, or string. You must use a variable whose data type is the same as that of the specified signal to save the result.

        Sample code for obtaining an ADAS signal value: 

         
 try {
     Boolean signalValue = InfoAssistManager.getAdasSignal(Boolean.class,
                           InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_TRANSFER_360DATA_SWITCH);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propClass - Indicates the data type of the specified signal, for example, Long.class.
        propertyId - Identifies the ADAS signal to obtain.
        Returns:
        Returns the ADAS signal value, which can be of the byte, short, int, float, or string type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be obtained, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • setAdasActuator

        public static <T> void setAdasActuator​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                                       AdasActuatorCallback callback,
                                       T value)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                       java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the actuator-type ADAS signal value of a specified primitive data type.

        You can set only the ADAS information-specific signal values that support setting. The data type can be byte, short, int, float, or string.

        Sample code for setting an ADAS signal value: 

         String adasActuatorId = InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_TRANSFER_360DATA_SWITCH;
 Boolean value = true;
 AdasActuatorCallback callback = new AdasActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 };
 try {
     InfoAssistManager.setAdasActuator(adasActuatorId, callback, value);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the ADAS signal value of the actuator type.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        value - Indicates the signal value, which must be of a primitive data type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be set, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • sendAdasSignal

        public static void sendAdasSignal​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                                  AdasActuatorCallback callback,
                                  byte[] request)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                  ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                  java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sends the request for an ADAS signal of the specified byte array type.

        You can send requests for only ADAS info-specific signal values that support setting. The requested signal values are of the byte array type. You must use the data format defined by Protocol Buffers to serialize and deserialize the signal values.

        Sample code for sending the request for an ADAS signal: 

         String adasActuatorId = InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_DRIVER_STATUS;
 byte[] value = new byte[n];
 AdasActuatorCallback callback = new AdasActuatorCallback() {
     @Override
     public void onErrorActuator(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 };
 try {
     InfoAssistManager.sendAdasSignal(adasActuatorId, callback, value);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the ADAS signal value of the actuator type.
        callback - Indicates the setting error callback.
        request - Indicates the requested signal value in a byte array, which needs to be parsed based on the specified format.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist, cannot be set, or is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeAdasSignal

        public static AdasSubscription subscribeAdasSignal​(java.lang.String propertyId,
                                                   AdasSignalCallback callback,
                                                   long interval)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                                   java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the specified ADAS signal value.

        You can subscribe to only the ADAS information-specific signal values that support subscription.

        Sample code for subscribing to an ADAS signal value: 

         String adasPropertyId = InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_DRIVER_STATUS;
 long interval = 400;
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl implements AdasSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl callback = new AdasSignalCallbackImpl();
 try {
     AdasSubscription subscription = InfoAssistManager.subscribeAdasSignal(adasPropertyId, callback,
                                                                           interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
        Parameters:
        propertyId - Identifies the ADAS signal value to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. Currently, this parameter does not take effect. Instead, the subscription period reported by the VSA layer is used.
        Returns:
        Returns the subscription descriptor (used for unsubscription) if the subscription is successful.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input propertyId does not exist or callback is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeBatchProperties

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AdasSubscription> subscribeBatchProperties​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> propertyIds,
                                                                                        AdasSignalCallback callback,
                                                                                        long interval)
        Subscribes to specified ADAS signal values in batches.

        This method is intended for ADAS signal values using the same subscription period and callback. A maximum of 20 signal values can be subscribed to in a batch.

        Sample code for subscribing to ADAS signal values in batches: 

         
 List<String> propertyIds = new ArrayList<>();
 propertyIds.add(InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_DRIVER_STATUS);
 propertyIds.add(InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_FREESPACE_STATUS);
 long interval = Long.MAX_VALUE;
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl implements AdasSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl callback = new AdasSignalCallbackImpl();
 Map<String, AdasSubscription> result = InfoAssistManager.subscribeBatchProperties(propertyIds,
                                                   callback, interval);
        ;
        Parameters:
        propertyIds - Indicates the IDs of ADAS signal values to subscribe to.
        callback - Indicates the subscription callback.
        interval - Indicates the subscription period. Currently, the value of this parameter does not take effect. Instead, the subscription period reported by the VSA layer is used.
        Returns:
        Returns a map of IDs and subscription descriptors of ADAS signal values.

        You can determine whether the subscription of a specified signal value is successful based on the return value. Specifically, the subscription succeeded if its descriptor is not null and failed if its descriptor is null.

        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeAdasSignal

        public static void unsubscribeAdasSignal​(AdasSubscription subscription)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                         ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from the specified ADAS signal value.

        You must use the subscription descriptor returned by subscribeAdasSignal(java.lang.String, ohos.ivihardware.adas.model.AdasSignalCallback, long) as the value for the input parameter subscription.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from an ADAS signal value: 

         String adasPropertyId = InfoAssistManager.ID_INFO_OBSTACLE;
 long interval = Long.MAX_VALUE;
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl implements AdasSignalCallback {
     @Override
     public void onChangeSignal(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo) {
     }
     @Override
     public void onErrorSignal(String propId, int errorCode) {
     }
 }
 AdasSignalCallbackImpl callback = new AdasSignalCallbackImpl();
 AdasSubscription subscription = null;
 try {
     subscription = InfoAssistManager.subscribeAdasSignal(adasPropertyId, callback, interval);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 };
 try {
     InfoAssistManager.unsubscribeAdasSignal(subscription);
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Parameters:
        subscription - Identifies the successful subscription.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the input parameter is invalid, for example, if the input subscription is null.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeAdasSignalAll

        public static void unsubscribeAdasSignalAll​()
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                            ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                            java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from all ADAS information-specific signal values.

        Sample code for unsubscribing from all ADAS information-specific signal values: 

         
 try {
     InfoAssistManager.unsubscribeAdasSignalAll();
 } catch (RemoteException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
 }
        ;
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if an error occurs at the service layer.
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable or the method is not supported.
        Since:
        3
